intro: Urostachys cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' erythroxylum, is a flowering plant species native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Erythroxylaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are often red or orange in color. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species with limited distribution.
